modules

Class ModuleNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.parallelization.CallbackReceiverImpl
      • modules.ModuleNetwork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CallbackReceiver, Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    public class ModuleNetwork
extends CallbackReceiverImpl
    Allows the construction of a tree of modules.
    Author:
    Marcel Boeing

    • Method Detail

      • getCompatiblePipe

        public static Pipe getCompatiblePipe(Port port1,
                                     Port port2)
                              throws NotSupportedException,
                                     IOException
        Determines which pipe to use between both given module ports (prefers byte pipe).
        Parameters:
        port1 - Module port 1
        port2 - Module port 2
        Returns:
        Compatible pipe
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurs
        NotSupportedException - Thrown if the module ports' I/O is not compatible

      • getStartedThreads

        public Map<Module,Thread> getStartedThreads()
        Returns:
        Returns a map of the running module threads

      • addStartedThread

        public void addStartedThread(Module module,
                             Thread thread)
        Adds a thread to the list of the ones started in a thread-safe manner. If there already is a thread associated to the specified module, it will be interrupted.
        Parameters:
        module - Module that the thread is associated to
        thread - Thread to add

      • removeStartedThread

        public boolean removeStartedThread(Thread thread)
        Removes a thread from the list of the ones started in a thread-safe manner.
        Parameters:
        thread - Thread to remove
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • removeDeadThreads

        public void removeDeadThreads()
        Removes dead threads from the list of the ones started in a thread-safe manner.

      • interruptAllThreads

        public void interruptAllThreads()

      • addConnection

        public boolean addConnection(Port port1,
                             Port port2)
                      throws NotSupportedException,
                             OccupiedException,
                             IOException
        Adds a connection between two I/O ports using a compatible pipe.
        Parameters:
        port1 - Port 1 to connect
        port2 - Port 2 to connect
        Returns:
        True if successful
        Throws:
        NotSupportedException - Thrown if there is no pipe that is compatible with both ports
        OccupiedException - Thrown if the input port is occupied
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurs

      • addConnection

        public boolean addConnection(Port outputPort,
                             Port inputPort,
                             Pipe pipe)
                      throws NotSupportedException,
                             OccupiedException
        Adds a connection between two I/O ports.
        Parameters:
        outputPort - Outputport to connect
        inputPort - Inputport to connect
        pipe - Pipe to connect the two ports
        Returns:
        True if successful
        Throws:
        NotSupportedException - Thrown if the pipe is not compatible with both ports
        OccupiedException - Thrown if the input port is occupied

      • removeConnection

        public boolean removeConnection(InputPort inputPort)
                         throws NotFoundException
        Removes the connection associated to the specified input port.
        Parameters:
        inputPort - Input port
        Returns:
        True if successful
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - Thrown if there is no pipe associated to the specified input port

      • removeConnection

        public boolean removeConnection(OutputPort outputPort)
                         throws NotFoundException
        Removes all connections associated to the specified output port.
        Parameters:
        outputPort - Output port
        Returns:
        True if successful
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - Thrown if there the specified output port is null

      • stopModules

        public void stopModules()
                 throws SecurityException
        Stops all running modules.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Thrown if the JVM does not allow one of the threads to be interrupted

      • runModules

        public void runModules()
                throws Exception
        Runs all modules. Note that this method does not wait for the threads to finish, so you should only call it from within another continuous thread or loop.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown if something goes wrong

      • runModules

        public void runModules(boolean runUntilAllThreadsAreDone)
                throws Exception
        Runs all modules.
        Parameters:
        runUntilAllThreadsAreDone - If true, the method blocks until all spawned threads have finished
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown if something goes wrong

      • runModules

        public void runModules(boolean runUntilAllThreadsAreDone,
                       long interval)
                throws Exception
        Runs all modules.
        Parameters:
        runUntilAllThreadsAreDone - If true, the method runs until all spawned threads have finished
        interval - Interval to check for thread completion in milliseconds
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown if something goes wrong

      • resetModuleIO

        public void resetModuleIO()
                   throws Exception
        Resets the modules' I/O. Must be called prior re-running the module tree.
        Throws:
        Exception - Thrown if something goes wrong

        Adds a new module.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if successful

        Returns:

        public boolean removeAllModules()
